xwikidoc.name: ccmArchive20140318
xwikidoc.creator: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.author: XWiki.sdumitriu
xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #ccm on 18 March 2014
xwikidoc.content: <ruthgrace> my first pull request :) 00:05 <ruthgrace> Thanks @sdumitriu ! 00:07 <sdumitriu> You're welcome 01:42 <ruthgrace> Hey @sdumitriu, would you be willing to look over the first draft of my project proposal? 01:42 <ruthgrace> And give me some feedback? 01:42 <sdumitriu> Sure 01:46 <ruthgrace> I uploaded it here: http://ruthgrace.weebly.com/gsoc-proposal.html 01:46 <ruthgrace> any and all criticisms are welcome! :) 01:46 <ruthgrace> thank you so much! 01:47 <ruthgrace> I haven't uploaded any code samples yet, so that section has no links. 01:47 <sdumitriu> Cool, LaTeX! 01:47 <ruthgrace> :) 01:48 <ruthgrace> Do you think I should have some sort of flowchart or graphic to display the tentative archetecture in a way that is more easy to read? 01:49 <ruthgrace> Also I am generally worried that I will lose marks on not having enough actual programming experience. My lab work consists largely of scripting, rather than making actual programs. 01:49 <sdumitriu> Did you read the papers that Asha suggested? 01:50 <ruthgrace> Yes, the pathway analysis one 01:51 <ruthgrace> He actually suggested to me that we start with the simple Over-Representation Analysis and move on to Functional Class Scoring after that 01:51 <ruthgrace> Sorry, I should say that the paper he linked me talked about Over-Representation analysis, which is the easiest, then Functional Class Scoring, and finally 3rd generation analysis 01:52 <ruthgrace> Asha is working on a 3rd generation analysis approach, and he said that we could implement that if it works out. 01:52 <sdumitriu> Typo: it's architecture, not archetecture 01:52 <ruthgrace> Whoops, thank you ! 01:54 <ruthgrace> Are you a bioinformatician? 01:55 <sdumitriu> No, pure software developer 01:55 <sdumitriu> Previous open source: you could mention your experience as a user 01:55 <ruthgrace> Oh, good idea. Thank you. 01:57 <sdumitriu> OK, looks good so far 01:57 <sdumitriu> Personally, I would like to see more details from the implementation perspective 01:57 <ruthgrace> Sure. Should that be a part of the proposal? I was going to write out some skeleton classes with empty methods. 01:58 <ruthgrace> Would it be appropriate to put those details there? Or is it alright to make the Tentative Architecture section really big 01:58 <sdumitriu> The architecture part details the scientific side well, and I guess that for this project it's important to have that pinned down 01:58 <sdumitriu> But for most "software" projects in GSoC, architecture usually means how the code will be organized 01:59 <ruthgrace> Ooohhhh 01:59 <sdumitriu> If you make a stub of the implementation, and just link to it from the proposal, I guess that should work 01:59 <ruthgrace> Perhaps I can split it up into a section about how the code will be organized, and another section about the scientific aspects 02:00 <sdumitriu> Code "speaks" better than words 02:00 <ruthgrace> That will be much less messy :) 02:00 <sdumitriu> Yes 02:04 <ruthgrace> Do you think it's worth sending my next proposal draft to the ccm-mentors email for feedback? 02:05 <sdumitriu> You should submit it through Melange 02:36 <ruthgrace> I am exhausted! I will deal with my code samples tomorrow. Have a good night, @sdumitriu ! Thank you for everything. 02:36 <sdumitriu> You're welcome 02:36 <sdumitriu> Good night 03:32 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 03:41 <tweety098> Hi I'm interested in working on the project 'Development of machine learning methods for modeling the evolution o tumors' 03:43 <tweety098> I'm going through the source code provided. Can anyone guide me as to where do I get started as in what code patches should I work upon? 06:03 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 07:41 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 08:26 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 08:50 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 09:35 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 10:12 <tweety098> ? 10:12 <tweety098> ? 10:25 <shalini479> has joined #ccm 10:25 <shalini479> has left #ccm 10:25 <shalini479> has joined #ccm 10:30 <sdumitriu> has joined #ccm 10:42 <sdumitriu1> has joined #ccm 10:48 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 10:49 <ruthgrace> has joined #ccm 10:50 <ruthgrace> @sdumitriu_: Linux mint isn't one of the OSs that infobright supports. :( I'll try today on Windows 7. 11:36 <ruthgrace> has joined #ccm 11:36 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 12:34 <ruthgrace> has joined #ccm 12:45 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 12:53 <shalini479> has joined #ccm 12:57 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 13:04 <SayAsh_> has joined #ccm 13:16 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 13:34 <shalini479> has left #ccm 13:56 <SayAsh> has joined #ccm 14:54 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 18:01 <tweety098> has joined #ccm 19:11 <Shubham> has joined #ccm 19:11 <Shubham> Hi ! 19:22 <Shubham> has joined #ccm 19:34 <sdumitriu> Hi Shubham 19:35 <Shubham> Hi sdumitriu. I have submitted my first proposal. Would you like to suggest some improvements I can make ? 19:36 <Shubham> Its the first draft. So, brutal scrutiny will be appreciated :) 19:37 <sdumitriu> Not today, sorry, I was just about to leave 20:00 <Shubham> has joined #ccm 20:29 <ruthgrace> has joined #ccm 20:33 <Shubham> has joined #ccm 20:35 <ruthgrace> Hi, when running the MedSavant client, what should I put in for DATABASE ? 20:36 <ruthgrace> I think HOSTNAME is localhost and PORT is 5029, but i'm not sure what the database name is 20:36 <ruthgrace> do i have to make one ? 20:36 <sdumitriu> Yes 20:39 <ruthgrace> Do you have sample data to load in? 20:40 <sdumitriu> Marc should know where to find it 20:40 <sdumitriu> But you can look for VCF files 20:40 <ruthgrace> Okay. Thank you! 21:09 <ruthgrace> hey tweety 21:09 <ruthgrace> are you going to try to do a MedSavant project? 21:44 <woohee> has joined #ccm 21:45 <woohee> good evening 21:51 <ruthgrace> has joined #ccm 21:55 <groundnuty> has joined #ccm 21:57 <groundnuty> Greetings, I'm a PhD student from Poland and I'm strongly considering applying for one of your Proposals connected with PhyloSub 21:57 <groundnuty> preferably the one connected with rewriting the code from Python to C++ 22:00 <groundnuty> I had truble judging how detailed description of architecture/timeling is required and after trying to consult this on #gosc I was adviced to ask the mentoring organization 22:04 <groundnuty> if possible I would be greatefull for any information on that subject 22:34 <ruthgrace> has joined #ccm 22:59 <ruthgrace> @sdumitriu sorry, dumb question, but how do I make a database using the infobright mysqld server? 23:00 <ruthgrace> I've managed to set it up so that the server is running under the username mysql and I don't have access to it even as root 23:01 <ruthgrace> (I switched back to linux mint - I think I just didn't sudo something before, because for some reason the servers are working now)
